name: Probability and Statistics for Business Applications
base_name: Probability and Statistics for Business Applications

equiv.name: Probability and Statistics for Business Applications

long_desc: Elementary ideas in probability, statistics, and data analysis are presented in the context of their importance to modern business management.  This course may use thirdparty course material that is not available for individual purchase from the publisher.   If so, the thirdparty course material will be secured and provided by the Tepper School to students enrolled in the course, and students enrolled in the course will be required to pay to the University the associated additional course materials fee for the thirdparty course material provided.   The amount of the course materials fee is dependent on the Universitys cost of the particular materials provided, and typically ranges from 13 to 75.

custom_fields.goals: Recognize, utilize, implement statistical methods to solve business problems and communicate the arguments to people in business
custom_fields.key_topics: The course will cover the application of probability, statistics and data to practical problems in business
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students should have familiarity with calculus and mathematical reasoning
custom_fields.assessment_structure: There will be several problem sets; three midterm exams and a final exam.
custom_fields.relevance: Students will be able to apply statistical and empirical methods to solve problems in stochastic environments in business. This course is cross-listed and primary business majors should register for 70207.
custom_fields.learning_resources:
This course uses R as the main statistical program, but no prior knowledge of R is required. The following textbooks are optional:
1. 'The Practice of Statistics for Business and Economics ' by Moore et al., 4th Edition.
2. 'Essentials of Statistics for Business and Economics' by Anderson et al., 8th Edition.
